page.title: 04Working at Sharlston Pit
page.content: My Dad is a coal miner who works at Sharlston pit. He is a qualified deputy. He works underground, where he does inspections of districts, headings,roadways and faces. He also supervises men doing their work. He has been a miner for 23 years and spent all that time at Sharlston. He works shifts and overtime. The mine is 1,800ft. deep and it takes about an hour to get to the face. Machines include a shearer for cutting coal and a dosco for cutting roadways. Most of the coal goes to the power stations. There are about 1300 men working at the pit and coal reserves for another 15 to 20 years.
